docs.title: Home
docs.text: Hi, I'm Mars and this is a blog. The last time I tried a personal blog like this was the dawn of the internet. Google was a startup, Geocities was still alive, and Dreamweaver was a thing. I started to code again in 2019ish, sometime after law school. This is an attempt to record notes and things I've learned, in the futile hope that I don't forget them.

docs.title: Academic Background
docs.text: Degree Institution Computer Science University of the Philippines Law University of the Philippines

docs.title: Stack
docs.text: Aspect Choice by preference Base Python, SQL, JS Web Django, FastAPI CSS TailwindCSS, Bootstrap JS htmx, hyperscript Database sqlite, postgresql Data Datasette, Pydantic, sqlite-utils Templating DTL, Jinja CLI flyctl Docs mkdocs, mkdocstrings, mkdocs-material

docs.title: Tech-Related Work
docs.text: Work Organization Description CEO Apptitude Info Tech Solutions, Inc. Know-your-learner-based learning management system with certificates issued on private blockchain node CEO Choose Coffee or Code, Inc. Bespoke digital solutions including inventory management, booking systems, etc.

docs.title: Law-Based Publications
docs.text: Topic Title Remote Notarization Notarization in the New Normal: White Paper on Remote Online Notarization in the Philippines Telco Competition Telconopoly: Overthrowing the Shadow of Regulatory Capture and Opportunism in Philippine Telecommunications through Effective Competition Policy Virtual Propery Virtual Property: A Modified Usufruct of Intangibles

docs.title: sqlpyd
docs.text: An attempt to use sqlite-utils with pydantic.

docs.title: citation-utils
docs.text: Extract Philippine legal citations representing Supreme Court decisions from an arbitrary piece of text.

docs.title: statute-trees
docs.text: Create nested representations of statutes, codified statutes, and general legal documents, using Philippine law as test case.

docs.title: lawData
docs.text: Hosting content built with citation-utils and statute-trees as an sqlite database queryable via Datasette.

docs.title: lawSQL
docs.text: Using the database built with lawdata, generate a Django site styled with TailwindCSS.
